quote_last: at the Copley Hotel on Huntingdon Avenue, the adrenaline pumping through his body. He repeated the Harvard Business School motto to himself as he was ushered into a small private room: look British, think Yiddish.
quote_raw: David arrived at 2:45 P.M. at the Copley Hotel on Huntingdon Avenue, the adrenaline pumping through his body. He repeated the Harvard Business School motto to himself as he was ushered into a small private room: look British, think Yiddish.
title: Not a Penny More, Not a Penny Less
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote_first: He glanced down at his watch. He had been smiling as he stroked her awake, and was smiling now. “
quote_last: . I sat in my stupid old motel room for almost two hours after we talked, trying to convince myself that what I was thinking couldn’t be true. Only I didn’t get where I am by dodging the truth.”
quote_raw: He glanced down at his watch. He had been smiling as he stroked her awake, and was smiling now. “Quarter to three. I sat in my stupid old motel room for almost two hours after we talked, trying to convince myself that what I was thinking couldn’t be true. Only I didn’t get where I am by dodging the truth.”
title: Full Dark, No Stars
author: Stephen King

quote_first: The young tinker girl knocked at the back door at
quote_last: . Marjan recognized her as one of the many freckled faces that lingered at the café windows long after other curious schoolchildren had left their mucky handprints behind.
quote_time_case: quarter to three in the afternoon
quote_raw: The young tinker girl knocked at the back door at quarter to three in the afternoon. Marjan recognized her as one of the many freckled faces that lingered at the café windows long after other curious schoolchildren had left their mucky handprints behind.
title: Pomegranate Soup
author: Marsha Mehran

quote_raw: He never came down till a quarter to three.
title: The Diary of a Nobody
author: George and Weedon Grossmith

quote_raw: Pull the other one, and tell it to the marines, and don't make me laugh, and fuck off out of it, and all that, but the fact remained that it was still only two forty-five'.
title: The Pregnant Window
author: Martin Amis

quote_first:
What time is it?
"Look for yourself," the old woman says to me. I look, and I see the clock has no hands.
"There are no hands," I say.
The old woman looks at the clock face and says to me, "It's a
quote_raw:
What time is it?
"Look for yourself," the old woman says to me. I look, and I see the clock has no hands.
"There are no hands," I say.
The old woman looks at the clock face and says to me, "It's a quarter to three."
title: The Old Woman
author: Daniil Ivanovich Kharms
